PLATEAU Workshop
Bringing together Programming Languages and Human-Computer Interaction
Home Registration Program Prior Year Sites

PLATEAU2021
12th annual workshop on the intersection of HCI and PL
@ Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh PA USA Tuesday November 9, 2021

PLATEAU will take place on the Carnegie Mellon University campus in Pittsburgh, PA on November 9, 2021. The workshop will be held in the Collaborative Innovation Center in the Panther Hollow Room (4th floor, Room 4105).

This is a draft schedule for planning purposes! Expect small tweaks as we approach the week of the workshop!

Welcome and Intro Session 10:00 AM–10:15 AM
Methodology
Conducting Browser-Based User Studies in Software Engineering, Lavinia Dunagan and Joshua Sunshine 10:15 AM–10:40 AM
Design Spaces of Domain-Specific Languages: Comparing and Contrasting Approaches in PL and HCI, Jonathan Zong, Josh Pollock, Dylan Wootton and Arvind Satyanarayan 10:40 AM–11:05 AM
Coffee Break 11:05 AM–11:20 AM
User Insights 1
Rethinking Debugging and Debuggers, Abdulaziz Alaboudi and Thomas D. LaToza 11:20 AM–11:45 AM
Program Recognition in Synthesis, Michael James and Nadia Polikarpova 11:45 AM–12:05 PM
Lunch 12:05 PM–1:35 PM
Interventions
Programming Tools for Working with Design Decisions in Code, Sahar Mehrpour and Thomas D. LaToza 1:35 PM–2:00 PM
Interaction Templates: A Data-Driven Approach for Authoring Robot Programs, David Porfirio, Maya Cakmak, Allison Sauppé, Aws Albarghouthi and Bilge Mutlu 2:00 PM–2:20 PM
Combining Interactive and Whole-Program Editing with Repartee, Luna Phipps-Costin, Michael MacLeod, Alex Vo, Tiffany Nguyen, Joe Politz, Shriram Krishnamurthi and Benjamin Lerner 2:20 PM–2:45 PM
Design Opportunities
Change in Software Ecosystems: Social Challenges of Automating Upgrades, Gabriel Matute, Alvin Cheung and Sarah Chasins 2:45 PM–3:05 PM
Applying Information Flow to Program Comprehension, Will Crichton 3:05 PM–3:30 PM
Coffee Break 3:30 PM–3:45 PM
User Insights 2
Collecting Insights about How Novice Programmers Naturally Express Programs for Robots, Rajeswari Hita Kambhamettu, Michael Jae-Yoon Chung, Vinitha Ranganeni and Patrícia Alves-Oliveira 3:45 PM–4:10 PM
Program Path Complexity and Code Comprehension, Sofiane Dissem, Eli Pregerson, Adi Bhargava, Josh Cordova and Lucas Bang 4:10 PM–4:35 PM
Wrap Up 4:35 PM–5:00 PM
Important Dates
September 14, 2021 (AoE time)

Tuesday November 9, 2021
